sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>Chinese</radical> <radical>turkey</radical> is <kanji>difficult</kanji> to find because they are so rare. Chinese turkeys are the rarest variety of turkey, so naturally, finding one is exceedingly difficult.
meaningInfo: Try and picture a Chinese turkey in your brain. Now imagine yourself trying to catch it, but you just can’t. It’s too difficult. The Chinese turkey is too elusive.
readingMnemonic: Do you know the actual reason Chinese turkeys are so <kanji>difficult</kanji> to find? Do you know how many Chinese turkeys there are in the world? <reading>None</reading> (<ja>なん</ja>). They don’t exist. How many Chinese turkeys are there? None.
readingInfo: So this is why you had such a difficult time finding and catching one – there were none to be caught. Imagine the sadness you felt when you realized that there were no Chinese turkeys to catch and that none exist in this world.
